subject: API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 09:33:14.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/types.py', 'releasenotes/notes/lookup-ignore-malformed-macs-09e7e909f3a134a3.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_ramdisk.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/ramdisk.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_types.py'], 'message': "API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses

This patch is adding code to ignore malformed MAC addresses which are
called as part of the lookup() mechanism. Prior to this patch, if a MAC
address wasn't in the expected format (six octets) the deployment of the
node would fail because the ramdisk wouldn't be able to lookup which
node it was in the Ironic database. One way to trigger this problem was
to deploy a node with an Infiniband Card which the MAC address (or GID)
contains 20 octets, that would result in a deployment failure even when
that NIC wasn't used by Ironic at all (not enrolled as a port).

The ListOfMacAdresses type was also deleted as part of this patch
because it wasn't used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I614fe63236985438d2f354d17a15d17649e72912
Closes-Bug: #1633585
(cherry picked from commit e0fd53d1830a76e8eb99be899b8302769b4fa649)
"}]
commit_message:
API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses

This patch is adding code to ignore malformed MAC addresses which are
called as part of the lookup() mechanism. Prior to this patch, if a MAC
address wasn't in the expected format (six octets) the deployment of the
node would fail because the ramdisk wouldn't be able to lookup which
node it was in the Ironic database. One way to trigger this problem was
to deploy a node with an Infiniband Card which the MAC address (or GID)
contains 20 octets, that would result in a deployment failure even when
that NIC wasn't used by Ironic at all (not enrolled as a port).

The ListOfMacAdresses type was also deleted as part of this patch
because it wasn't used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I614fe63236985438d2f354d17a15d17649e72912
Closes-Bug: #1633585
(cherry picked from commit e0fd53d1830a76e8eb99be899b8302769b4fa649)

subject: Move storage_address discovery into a single task
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-03 21:46:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml'], 'message': 'Move storage_address discovery into a single task

The storage address variable needs to be defined before running other
common tasks. The `storage_address` variable, when defined in a cinder
storage backend, causes an exception at runtime as the host_var will be
undefined. This patch moves the `storage_address` discovery set of tasks
into its one task and allows the option to be known before running
anything else.

Closes-Bug: #1632393
Change-Id: I547c72943396af92df2a298470e3f89b4d1e3a2d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move storage_address discovery into a single task

The storage address variable needs to be defined before running other
common tasks. The `storage_address` variable, when defined in a cinder
storage backend, causes an exception at runtime as the host_var will be
undefined. This patch moves the `storage_address` discovery set of tasks
into its one task and allows the option to be known before running
anything else.

Closes-Bug: #1632393
Change-Id: I547c72943396af92df2a298470e3f89b4d1e3a2d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix BaseException.message deprecation messages
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-03 23:24:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/generate.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Fix BaseException.message deprecation messages

When running inventory tests locally on Python 2.7.12, the following
warning was displayed for some tests:

/home/nrb/projects/openstack-ansible/tests/test_inventory.py:565:
DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of
Python 2.6

This change updates references to exception.message to use the str
method of access, which is the replacement.

A __str__ method was also added the LxcHostsDefined exception to be more
consistent.

Change-Id: I75fd2da4a31b75916f10502134913c8bacbc34f0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BaseException.message deprecation messages

When running inventory tests locally on Python 2.7.12, the following
warning was displayed for some tests:

/home/nrb/projects/openstack-ansible/tests/test_inventory.py:565:
DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of
Python 2.6

This change updates references to exception.message to use the str
method of access, which is the replacement.

A __str__ method was also added the LxcHostsDefined exception to be more
consistent.

Change-Id: I75fd2da4a31b75916f10502134913c8bacbc34f0

commit_message:
libvirt: sync time on resumed from suspend instances

Time is not being synchronized for migrated or resumed from suspend instances
as guest.resume() method is not being called on these operations.

Calling sync_guest_time directly in the resume method as well as in
finish_migration.

Resolves-Bug: #1636565

Change-Id: Ie140bc0912e6b312d3fcbee7e9650a81076eda4d

commit_message:
Disable SMT for ppc64 hypervisor and set VNC

On ppc64le KVM hypervisor SMT is enabled by default.
Adding the task to disable SMT to allow launching the instance in
running state.

Setting the default console type as noVNC for ppc64 arch.

Change-Id: I119455a499255725dd616eb488a1c67f828d925a
(cherry picked from commit 55c89fc11842ea6c008fc4b592d3b7077e801eef)

commit_message:
Suppress use of the default gateway provided by Undercloud

This change is meant to disable use of the default gateway provided
by the Undercloud DHCP so that it can be configured to point at
different IPs, for the different roles, in the os-net-config templates.

Change-Id: I840c4345bdf39d08f76e30ec70127974c53d29c2

subject: Fixing 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:26:13.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_create_server.py'], 'message': "Fixing 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test

The 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test has been recently
broken by the patch [1]. The traceback can be found in logs of the
'gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh' job [2]. The test fails with error [3].

When we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk, the 'ephemeral' argument
is unexpected. So we don't need to pass the 'ephemeral' argument to the
'create_flavor' method when we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390198/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/98/390198/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh/fef3bfd/logs/testr_results.html.gz
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587678/

Change-Id: I0cdbba827640d09d7b1fb8e1f3c0b56013a5d3a6
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test

The 'test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk' test has been recently
broken by the patch [1]. The traceback can be found in logs of the
'gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh' job [2]. The test fails with error [3].

When we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk, the 'ephemeral' argument
is unexpected. So we don't need to pass the 'ephemeral' argument to the
'create_flavor' method when we create a flavor with no ephemeral disk.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390198/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/98/390198/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh/fef3bfd/logs/testr_results.html.gz
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/587678/

Change-Id: I0cdbba827640d09d7b1fb8e1f3c0b56013a5d3a6

commit_message:
Set the AIO to use bootstrap_host_public_interface

This patch namespaces the variables 'public_interface' and
'encapsulation_interface' to prevent any clashes, and sets
the AIO networking to configure the masquerade rules to use
'bootstrap_host_public_interface' as the interface it uses
instead of hard-coding it to eth0.

This allows testing with hosts which don't have eth0.

Change-Id: I9a494ae5290a2218cf8c8d2cd44b27fd7264313f

subject: Revert "setup: build config file at build time"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 07:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'gnocchi/genconfig.py'], 'message': 'Revert "setup: build config file at build time"

Generating the config file at build time is a bit fragile and depends on
how the setup is run (pip, setup.py install, setup.py develop).

For example, pip run bdist_wheel and that fail bdist, both
run the build_py hook. During the bdist_wheel only build dependencies
are available (only pbr for us), so that fail. In our case, it doesn't
because we ignore the exception. Even we block the wheel generation,
bdist will fail too if not all generators dependencies are present.

Perhaps revert this is more secure to ensure we have the configuration
file even it's not up2date.

This reverts commit 17ca48a387f3670d9ac78c4bdebade08c9dba479.

Change-Id: If39c06f8d6101494953813b3fda25f3c7aea9e96
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "setup: build config file at build time"

Generating the config file at build time is a bit fragile and depends on
how the setup is run (pip, setup.py install, setup.py develop).

For example, pip run bdist_wheel and that fail bdist, both
run the build_py hook. During the bdist_wheel only build dependencies
are available (only pbr for us), so that fail. In our case, it doesn't
because we ignore the exception. Even we block the wheel generation,
bdist will fail too if not all generators dependencies are present.

Perhaps revert this is more secure to ensure we have the configuration
file even it's not up2date.

This reverts commit 17ca48a387f3670d9ac78c4bdebade08c9dba479.

Change-Id: If39c06f8d6101494953813b3fda25f3c7aea9e96

commit_message:
Update api-ref, dev-docs to be accurate for Newton

Some commits updating the api-ref and dev-docs to indicate the
deprecated status of the Images v1 API did not make it into the
Newton RC.  This patch updates those docs so there's no confusion
about the status of the v1 API.

See this ML thread for more context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/104859.html

This patch:
- marks the Images v1 API as DEPRECATED in the api-ref
- updates the 'versions' response in the api-ref to be correct for
  Newton (v1 deprecation, v2 minor version bump)
- adds a "version history" to the api-ref
- adds a deprecation note to the developer docs

Closes-bug: #1629503
(cherry picked from commit 0a9bbd33c0295d972ad90b0bc118f3b1b472c885)
(cherry picked from commit cd65bfd0c7f8527a551050f1a9b275cfa75a97a1)
(cherry picked from commit 5ac85fdd75076c59844f058978111bd2a6a6c292)

Change-Id: I396cc172831d9d59ab7f50ef8c9de7170fbc4944

commit_message:
Fix modify_fields_from_db for vif_details empty str

vif_details is represented as an empty string in our DB schema
when it's not defined. The 'modify_fields_from_db' method was
incorrectly attempting to feed this directly into the json decoder.

Closes-Bug: #1638703
Change-Id: I7b13fb30de71bb4dce4dbab4ffe430e1d0ef8f3a

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-12 05:52:53.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/v2_0/shell.py'], 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Idf4237a687433acd5dc8a1eb8740195ac5968818
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: Idf4237a687433acd5dc8a1eb8740195ac5968818

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 04:53:46.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I0393c9e1b193ea2a8f73b9be2b79e19c47e43fcd
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I0393c9e1b193ea2a8f73b9be2b79e19c47e43fcd

subject: Update subport host_id when remove trunk port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 02:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovsdb_handler.py'], 'message': "Update subport host_id when remove trunk port

Currently removing a vm which boot with trunk port.
The neutron-server side won't update the port host_id. So this
period, the trunk subports' binding info is not same with the
parent port.

This patch make the agent to update the bind info of subports
during processing trunk remove action.

Change-Id: I763cf89dd0f5732ae1e070ec53595cbca7831231
Closes-bug: #1639111
"}]
commit_message:
Update subport host_id when remove trunk port

Currently removing a vm which boot with trunk port.
The neutron-server side won't update the port host_id. So this
period, the trunk subports' binding info is not same with the
parent port.

This patch make the agent to update the bind info of subports
during processing trunk remove action.

Change-Id: I763cf89dd0f5732ae1e070ec53595cbca7831231
Closes-bug: #1639111

subject: Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 14:51:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out

This is a simple patch to add the possibility to call a function when
the job timeout.
Some CI's relay on devstack-vm-gate-wrap, and this will enable third
party to collect some logs needed to debug for example, even when the
job timeout. This is very important to understand how and why the job
is failing.
Example of use: tripleo periodic jobs are failing with timeout and
there's some tempest failures, however, the logs are not being uploaded
because the way tripleo works, collect the logs script isn't being
executed, which makes hard to identify the root cause and find a
solution.
Besides, this won't interrupt or make it fails any job upstream, because
the jobs are not implementing the 'post_timeout_hook' function.

Change-Id: I9d06e0686c589c9b513e5cab4d39b87e2dd34c4c
"}]
commit_message:
Adding the ability to call a function when the job is timed out

This is a simple patch to add the possibility to call a function when
the job timeout.
Some CI's relay on devstack-vm-gate-wrap, and this will enable third
party to collect some logs needed to debug for example, even when the
job timeout. This is very important to understand how and why the job
is failing.
Example of use: tripleo periodic jobs are failing with timeout and
there's some tempest failures, however, the logs are not being uploaded
because the way tripleo works, collect the logs script isn't being
executed, which makes hard to identify the root cause and find a
solution.
Besides, this won't interrupt or make it fails any job upstream, because
the jobs are not implementing the 'post_timeout_hook' function.

Change-Id: I9d06e0686c589c9b513e5cab4d39b87e2dd34c4c

This change decrease period time from default 60 to 5 sec to avoid

Change-Id: I6af4dc6acebb673d256940278ca94a657774cdf9

commit_message:
Decrease cache sync time in inspector discovery job

We are deleting node from ironic for simulate node discovery,
so it's possible race when node cache become inconsistency.

This change decrease period time from default 60 to 5 sec to avoid
cache inconsistency.

Change-Id: I6af4dc6acebb673d256940278ca94a657774cdf9

Change-Id: I61169f872b077c57772442772b74b6313318dfd0

commit_message:
Remove create / pushSignedTag from release-managed

The release team now handles all release tasks for all official
OpenStack projects, including creating branches and pushing
signed tags. Some projects had leftover rights from when they
handled those tasks directly. Clean those up in order to
streamline ACLs across official projects.

Change-Id: I61169f872b077c57772442772b74b6313318dfd0

subject: Use dummy share driver of manila with rally CI jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 18:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/rally.yaml'], 'message': "Use dummy share driver of manila with rally CI jobs

For the moment we use two different share back ends for two existing
Rally CI jobs that run against manila project. It is redundant, as in
case of CI we intend to test main manila functionality, that is
back end agnostic. So, switch them to 'dummy' share driver and
disable all other redundant services, that also will reduce deployment
time.

Change-Id: I753a648349f7a3b8ede3ee714657638f4db68ec5
"}]
commit_message:
Use dummy share driver of manila with rally CI jobs

For the moment we use two different share back ends for two existing
Rally CI jobs that run against manila project. It is redundant, as in
case of CI we intend to test main manila functionality, that is
back end agnostic. So, switch them to 'dummy' share driver and
disable all other redundant services, that also will reduce deployment
time.

Change-Id: I753a648349f7a3b8ede3ee714657638f4db68ec5

subject: Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-03 18:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin

The requirements check job template is meant to be voting on
both check and gate should a repo choose to use the template.

Exceptions to this usage cause confusion and cargo culting.

No repo is required to run the requirements check job template
but should they choose to they are expected to use it as intended.

The requirements check job template is needed for a project to be
added to global requirements.

Change-Id: I5c1938a8069f8848069f5d30ce82aa010a84f569
'}]
commit_message:
Remove non-voting requirements check job from cisco plugin

The requirements check job template is meant to be voting on
both check and gate should a repo choose to use the template.

Exceptions to this usage cause confusion and cargo culting.

No repo is required to run the requirements check job template
but should they choose to they are expected to use it as intended.

The requirements check job template is needed for a project to be
added to global requirements.

Change-Id: I5c1938a8069f8848069f5d30ce82aa010a84f569

subject: Add undercloud job to tripleo-ui and puppet-tripleo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 16:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add undercloud job to tripleo-ui and puppet-tripleo

With I6cab4d2f00ed16b2afaef120c845e5fea49fb29c a sanity check to ensure
the UI loads correctly will be added to the undercloud CI job. The two
projects most likely to cause issues with the UI loading are tripleo-ui
and puppet-tripleo, therefore the undercloud job should be added to
their pipeline before we merge the new CI check.

Change-Id: Ie2211c744157971c3500970c2df2a1d8ae4a83e9
Related: blueprint tripleo-ui-basic-ci-check
'}]
commit_message:
Add undercloud job to tripleo-ui and puppet-tripleo

With I6cab4d2f00ed16b2afaef120c845e5fea49fb29c a sanity check to ensure
the UI loads correctly will be added to the undercloud CI job. The two
projects most likely to cause issues with the UI loading are tripleo-ui
and puppet-tripleo, therefore the undercloud job should be added to
their pipeline before we merge the new CI check.

Change-Id: Ie2211c744157971c3500970c2df2a1d8ae4a83e9
Related: blueprint tripleo-ui-basic-ci-check

commit_message:

integration between OpenStack and Ceph Rados Gateway.

RGW API, with IPv6 and SSL.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-02 03:34:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_falconstor_fss.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/falconstor/rest_proxy.py'], 'message': 'FalconStor: Fix creating snapshot failed

To create snapshot fail when the display name exceeds 32 characters.
So we change the snapshot naming solution from snapshot display name to
snapshot id and shrink it for FSS limitation.

Change-Id: I48de678242c6b200ee46dae44b7b964493f60e29
Closes-Bug: #1637044
'}]
commit_message:
FalconStor: Fix creating snapshot failed

To create snapshot fail when the display name exceeds 32 characters.
So we change the snapshot naming solution from snapshot display name to
snapshot id and shrink it for FSS limitation.

Change-Id: I48de678242c6b200ee46dae44b7b964493f60e29
Closes-Bug: #1637044

commit_message:

use the internal endpoint when creating nova flavors.

subject: bagpipe: rely on ROUTER_INTERFACE registry callbacks
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-10-20 19:58:27.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/bagpipe/test_bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py'], 'message': 'bagpipe: rely on ROUTER_INTERFACE registry callbacks

This change replaces the code trying to detect new router
interfaces based on PORT create/update notifications, by code simply
listening on ROUTER_INTERFACE created/deleted notifications.

Change-Id: Ibab3ab2adfc636d4a48775ea7e9ac7ffdf53dcdf
Closes-Bug: 1629358
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: rely on ROUTER_INTERFACE registry callbacks

This change replaces the code trying to detect new router
interfaces based on PORT create/update notifications, by code simply
listening on ROUTER_INTERFACE created/deleted notifications.

Change-Id: Ibab3ab2adfc636d4a48775ea7e9ac7ffdf53dcdf
Closes-Bug: 1629358

not passed at all the api returns all of the resources. but with empty

commit_message:
rest: empty search query in resource search

resource search should support empty query. Right now, if the query is
not passed at all the api returns all of the resources. but with empty
query, i.e. {}, it breaks.

Change-Id: I5f85bae0b710b67e6cbd0c3165666cf09c17e759

for a successful overcloud node query within tripleo-ansible-inventory.

subject: [WIP] Pass all role data to the jinja2 template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 08:41:12.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/templates.py'], 'message': "[WIP] Pass all role data to the jinja2 template

This commit makes the variable passed to the jinja2 template more
consistent bewteen *.role.j2.yaml and *.j2.yaml rendering.

Previously, only the name of the role was passed to the *.role.j2.yaml
templates making it impossible to do templating based on the role's
data.

This commit requires changing the `role` variable in *.role.j2.yaml
templates into `role.name`.

Change-Id: Id1d0d4e393661f4e246159373cf82cb870db1697
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Pass all role data to the jinja2 template

This commit makes the variable passed to the jinja2 template more
consistent bewteen *.role.j2.yaml and *.j2.yaml rendering.

Previously, only the name of the role was passed to the *.role.j2.yaml
templates making it impossible to do templating based on the role's
data.

This commit requires changing the `role` variable in *.role.j2.yaml
templates into `role.name`.

Change-Id: Id1d0d4e393661f4e246159373cf82cb870db1697

commit_message:
Change an attribute name from 'type' to 'type_name'

In client side, we have to use 'type_name' to get a value of profile type.
At the moment angular profile table doesn't show Profile Type because of
being using 'type'. So, this patch will change an attribute name.

Change-Id: I71d979ba8441b9aee66ffc82ebc2bdbabe58ad7a

subject: Add config option to create networks with port_security_enabled
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-15 21:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Add config option to create networks with port_security_enabled

The port_security extension in neutron is disabled by default.

devstack enables the port_security extension for ML2 but since
it's optional we shouldn't assume it's enabled, so this change
adds a configuration option to tell us if port security is
supported as a networking feature.

We could use the extension list but that defaults to all and
we shouldn't require tempest users to have to maintain a
whitelist of extensions just to make the default configuration
work with default neutron, i.e. not devstack.

This is also slightly different from the allow_port_security_disabled
option which is a temporary flag until liberty end of life at
which point nova can handle booting a server and attaching a
port with port security disabled.

To make this run in the integrated gate, devstack will need to
set CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security=True in all
branches except stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I1efd5c838aa0d73cc6e8864e3041eea25850198d
Closes-Bug: #1624082
"}]
commit_message:
Add config option to create networks with port_security_enabled

The port_security extension in neutron is disabled by default.

devstack enables the port_security extension for ML2 but since
it's optional we shouldn't assume it's enabled, so this change
adds a configuration option to tell us if port security is
supported as a networking feature.

We could use the extension list but that defaults to all and
we shouldn't require tempest users to have to maintain a
whitelist of extensions just to make the default configuration
work with default neutron, i.e. not devstack.

This is also slightly different from the allow_port_security_disabled
option which is a temporary flag until liberty end of life at
which point nova can handle booting a server and attaching a
port with port security disabled.

To make this run in the integrated gate, devstack will need to
set CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security=True in all
branches except stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I1efd5c838aa0d73cc6e8864e3041eea25850198d
Closes-Bug: #1624082

subject: Fix: k8s cluster creation with lb enabled/fip disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 13:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/environments/disable_floating_ip.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix: k8s cluster creation with lb enabled/fip disabled

Fixed creation of k8s cluster with enabled loadbalancer
and disabled floating ip. This was caused because of wrong
reference of heat resource in disable_floating_ip.yaml:-

Wrong: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::Pool::FloatingIP
Correct: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::FloatingIP

Change-Id: I6ff1c43ab7f48b22b9f52ee09aa20284a28975b1
Closes-Bug: #1630611
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: k8s cluster creation with lb enabled/fip disabled

Fixed creation of k8s cluster with enabled loadbalancer
and disabled floating ip. This was caused because of wrong
reference of heat resource in disable_floating_ip.yaml:-

Wrong: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::Pool::FloatingIP
Correct: Magnum::Optional::Neutron::FloatingIP

Change-Id: I6ff1c43ab7f48b22b9f52ee09aa20284a28975b1
Closes-Bug: #1630611

Failures in communication between nova and cinder and result in an
instance being deleted but the attached volume is not properly marked
as detached and cannot be deleted.

Force-delete is modified to delete attached volumes.

Change-Id: I2877a317e62a992246f19a4ae11c0e37125f50cd

commit_message:
Modify force-delete to delete attached volumes

Failures in communication between nova and cinder and result in an
instance being deleted but the attached volume is not properly marked
as detached and cannot be deleted.

Force-delete is modified to delete attached volumes.

Change-Id: I2877a317e62a992246f19a4ae11c0e37125f50cd
Co-Authored-By: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Closes-bug: 1636978

This change uses simplejson if available.

subject: Changed the start script name in cinder-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 09:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['docker/cinder/cinder-volume/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Changed the start script name in cinder-volume

In the Dockerfile of cinder-volume, the "kolla_extend_start" script
will be overwritten, and it will cause the cinder-volume container
doesn't create /var/log/kolla/cinder folder.
The name of the start script should be "kolla_cinder_extend_start" in
cinder-volume container.

Change-Id: I7251792a4fbe1442e2ffc5ebd9e41bd9cdc33568
Closes-Bug: #1638839
'}]
commit_message:
Changed the start script name in cinder-volume

In the Dockerfile of cinder-volume, the "kolla_extend_start" script
will be overwritten, and it will cause the cinder-volume container
doesn't create /var/log/kolla/cinder folder.
The name of the start script should be "kolla_cinder_extend_start" in
cinder-volume container.

Change-Id: I7251792a4fbe1442e2ffc5ebd9e41bd9cdc33568
Closes-Bug: #1638839

subject: Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 04:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/scripts/config_public_network.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/config_private_network.sh'], 'message': 'Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797
(cherry picked from commit b11bea604ec240a1a16076f509b62af1d70d7a1d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797
(cherry picked from commit b11bea604ec240a1a16076f509b62af1d70d7a1d)

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bridge setup when using Virtualbox additions

The environment for client-side scripts when called by osbashauto is not
exactly the same as when they are executed over ssh. It is the same user
(osbash), but the PATH differs and does not contain /sbin.

This patch adds the full path for brctl so the program is found on
Windows hosts (or other hosts using osbashauto) as well.

Change-Id: I23790ad4c5ac1b2f5e6afd2ee2e786abc7a51797

commit_message:
Add missing deprecation warning in admin guide, manage project security

In manage project security section, all the commands are deprecated and
will be removed after Nova 15.0.0. But the admin guide shows no clue
of this. This patch adds such warning to every command.

Besides, it also fixes the output of $ nova secgroup-list

Change-Id: Iafcc55bf70d17dad0d10be45af38ad4e3ef8b775
Closes-Bug: #1628766

commit_message:
objects: switch base plugin class to using subnetpool object

Among non-obvious changes, description field in standardattributes object
extension is now nullable, as in the database. This changes object hashes,
but we should be safe to touch it without providing a new object version
conversion rules because affected objects are not yet exposed to RPC
anywhere.

To avoid object API complexity, base class added support for
get_objects() keyword arguments that are not of list type (in which
case, we pass a single entry list down into _get_collection).

Also, some unit tests were changed to pass correct UUIDs for tenants, to
avoid validation warnings triggered by strict typing for subnetpool
project_id field.

Depends-On: I1c1bf544af4463b0302b62c8cce492932504bb01
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I1415c7a29af86d377ed31cce40888631a34d4811

commit_message:
objects: Removed project_id/tenant_id field translation

In Ocata, project_id is already in DB, no need to translate
the tenant_id to project_id when accessing Subnet entries.

Change-Id: I095d544c9d00bbf3908850edb380ecfa0dbaeda2
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
objects: add validate_filters option for count() method.

Since we are passing filters for count(), we have to add the choice
if count() method should validate or not the filters provided
(filters can be parsed from REST API).

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I3fd354db63fa27eb8992d951cc74014b693991c5

commit_message:
objects: Remove tenant_id from to_dict() when project_id is not set.

Current implementation will raise AttributeError when some object
will not have project_id set, but will call to_dict()/items() method.

This is affecting 7ba5b4ef259476b6f48b21d78c8d560bfb5be167.
This should not affect Newton.

Change-Id: If0c00aa5630fe575378ec3c8a2f17d7333951ae6
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
SUPER WIP OVO port object

Introduce the ovo Port object, PortBinding and IPAllocation.
AllowedAddressPair is the only extension enabled in this patch,
the others will follow.

TODO list
2) find a way to model port binding. There are few classes for
port binding, we need a way to handle that in the port object.
3) include the port extensions (port security, sec groups) once
they get merged
4) use the port object in the code base
5) add more tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Change-Id: Ie8ef777887ba027add7dd11958696581da8014fc
Co-Authored-By: Martin Hickey <martin.hickey@ie.ibm.com>

commit_message:
objects: rename tenant_id field to project_id for trunks

All occurrences of tenant term should be replaced with projects in the
tree. This patch renames the field from Trunk object. We are safe to do
it without bumping the object version for now because it's not exposed
on the wire so far.

Change-Id: Ied9d51e9f8f69246d9dc80c882cc5e11cef01b2b
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 20:34:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Update instance node on rebuild only when it is recreate

When using ironic virt driver, if scheduled_node is not specified
in rebuild_instance compute manager method (as it happens in case
of instance rebuild), the first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
ironic node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail, as virt driver
tries to set instance_uuid on a newly selected ironic node and fails.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Change-Id: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
(cherry picked from commit 54b122caec1ae2418fc3e296be604d072cb5815a)
'}]
commit_message:
Update instance node on rebuild only when it is recreate

When using ironic virt driver, if scheduled_node is not specified
in rebuild_instance compute manager method (as it happens in case
of instance rebuild), the first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
ironic node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail, as virt driver
tries to set instance_uuid on a newly selected ironic node and fails.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Change-Id: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
(cherry picked from commit 54b122caec1ae2418fc3e296be604d072cb5815a)

Currently we don't support options for the ansible hook, but it would
be useful to enable passing tags, like we already do for the puppet
hook.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-03 14:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py'], 'message': "pci: remove pci device from claims and allocations when freeing it

In drop_move_claim we call free pci device when we need to drop a
specific device from the src/dest node. This is done by calling
pci manager free_device. The current code just update the device
status to available in database but doesn't remove it from the
pci manager claims and allocations lists. This patch adds the
removal as well.

Closes-Bug: #1622854

Change-Id: If1cd6f3a635759cd55d116a34ca164630c61e085
"}]
commit_message:
pci: remove pci device from claims and allocations when freeing it

In drop_move_claim we call free pci device when we need to drop a
specific device from the src/dest node. This is done by calling
pci manager free_device. The current code just update the device
status to available in database but doesn't remove it from the
pci manager claims and allocations lists. This patch adds the
removal as well.

Closes-Bug: #1622854

Change-Id: If1cd6f3a635759cd55d116a34ca164630c61e085

Two tests were failing with the os-brick 1.7.0 release due to
executing operations related to destination volume creation and
failing to parse the mock object as the expected results.

Since the actual volume creation is not relevant to the scope of
these unit tests, the create_volume internal calls should just be

Change-Id: I1099b1045d3192ee37064f0c12181fa96870b87d
Closes-bug: #1638861

commit_message:
Mock volume create for LVM migration tests

Two tests were failing with the os-brick 1.7.0 release due to
executing operations related to destination volume creation and
failing to parse the mock object as the expected results.

Since the actual volume creation is not relevant to the scope of
these unit tests, the create_volume internal calls should just be
mocked out.

Change-Id: I1099b1045d3192ee37064f0c12181fa96870b87d
Closes-bug: #1638861

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 15:57:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-requirements-git-0d898621f1b62a29.yaml', 'tasks/ironic_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ie860ef9bc223621140205d465298c4009b86118a
(cherry picked from commit 47b5a171ca805135f675a1fee7f997a631480efb)
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ie860ef9bc223621140205d465298c4009b86118a
(cherry picked from commit 47b5a171ca805135f675a1fee7f997a631480efb)

commit_message:
Add QoS North Bound Functionality

This patch provides a notification driver for QoS Plugin. QoS plugin can
notify the north bound messages to Dragonflow by the notification driver.
The north bound messages the patch supported are as follows:
1. Create QoS
2. Update QoS
3. Delete Qos
4. Create port with QoS
5. Update port with QoS
6. Update network with QoS

coresponding spec:
Implements: blueprint qos-app

Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>
Co-Authored-By: xuxiaojie <xiaojie.xu@huawei.com>
Change-Id:I8ebebc40248374a424a14b93f186293a708c6b70

commit_message:
Fix database poison warnings, part 24

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (7 new ones) from:

    unit.compute.test_compute_mgr.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

Change-Id: Ibe23b977f24a2840eee6f8386d7c0bbbab6783fa
Related-Bug: #1568414

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I3b719139a143ed497ddcef29c54c2dcdf343cf64

Fix database poison warnings, part 23

The following warning appears in the unit test logs a number of times.

    "UserWarning: This test uses methods that set internal oslo_db
state, but it does not claim to use the database. This will conflict
with the setup of tests that do use the database and cause failures
later."

This patch fixes all the warnings (12 new ones) from:

    nova.tests.unit.virt.ironic.test_driver.py

Note that this warning is only emitted once per unit test worker, so new
offenders will show up in the logs each time you fix a test until they
are all gone.

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

The tests/os_keystone-overrides.yml file is removed
as it is unnecessary given the merge of
https://review.openstack.org/381479

Depends-On: I0e6d43a9f22add78f693e8836f1dd852be74d6c5
Change-Id: Ief9c7f124eb58b986192b2f958c971197d410799
(cherry picked from commit c5a0cce3c695ccd6ecb594fc8b3148e085e9a5d2)

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-03 10:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: fix incorrect host cpus giving to emulator threads when RT

Realtime guarantees in certain operating systems require that the
thread that is running the QEMU emulator is pinned to a physical CPU
that is *not* the same as any physical CPU that the vCPUs for a
realtime guest are pinned to. This patch ensures that the value of the
hw:cpu_realtime_mask flavor extraspec property is respected when
creating the libvirt configuration XML and sets emulatorpin values to
a physical CPU matching the hw:cpu_realtime_mask value.

Change-Id: I7f50dde0753b059a690dc50172fee645c94b8e5b
Closes-Bug: #1614054
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix incorrect host cpus giving to emulator threads when RT

Realtime guarantees in certain operating systems require that the
thread that is running the QEMU emulator is pinned to a physical CPU
that is *not* the same as any physical CPU that the vCPUs for a
realtime guest are pinned to. This patch ensures that the value of the
hw:cpu_realtime_mask flavor extraspec property is respected when
creating the libvirt configuration XML and sets emulatorpin values to
a physical CPU matching the hw:cpu_realtime_mask value.

Change-Id: I7f50dde0753b059a690dc50172fee645c94b8e5b
Closes-Bug: #1614054

commit_message:
Remove df-ext-services

df-ext-services was introduced in [1] for rejoin stack, while rejoin
stack has been removed by devstack at [2].

Now, df-ext-services.sh will change every time run devstack. And it will
restart nb db unnecessarily when run devstack, according to current code.

Since it is not used by devstack, this patch removes df-ext-services.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+bug/1510812
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291453/

Change-Id: I863afbed782aa24150c1a3cf9dc86ac99cb07da3
Closes-Bug: #1637686

Instead of breaking up package installations and removals into separate
tasks, this patch moves them all under one task that does two execution
steps.

In addition, the security_enable_chrony variable was added to control the
installation and configuration of chrony. The tox tests for the role were
configured to skip chrony in the gate using a skipped tag, but this caused

Change-Id: I1def033953b50be3911cd932fd17b10dd2c658b7

commit_message:
Speed up package install/removal

Instead of breaking up package installations and removals into separate
tasks, this patch moves them all under one task that does two execution
steps.

In addition, the security_enable_chrony variable was added to control the
installation and configuration of chrony. The tox tests for the role were
configured to skip chrony in the gate using a skipped tag, but this caused
the package install/removal task to get skipped.

Docs/release notes are included for the chrony change.

Change-Id: I1def033953b50be3911cd932fd17b10dd2c658b7

subject: Statically define the repo build concurrency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 15:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9
(cherry picked from commit 534f40f3dd890b6106e7783ea4dafee3457f3601)
'}]
commit_message:
Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9
(cherry picked from commit 534f40f3dd890b6106e7783ea4dafee3457f3601)

commit_message:
Release Neutron 9.1.0 (newton)

This change introduced a new configuration option
(ha_keepalived_state_change_server_threads) hence the minor version
bump.

Avoid tagging for vpnaas, fwaas and dynamic-routing
because those repositories did not get any updates since
previous release.

Change-Id: I0618cbde3d5390ae13b8a26204a1189592164a83

subject: Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6788, 'name': 'Rossella Sblendido', 'email': 'rsblendido@suse.com', 'username': 'rossella-o'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15518, 'name': 'Artur Korzeniewski', 'email': 'artur.korzen@wp.pl', 'username': 'akorzeni'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20363, 'name': 'Adit Sarfaty', 'email': 'asarfaty@vmware.com', 'username': 'asarfaty'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 20:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/common_types.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_common_types.py'], 'message': "Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork

Both of these OVO common types did not have a to_primitive
method, so their native netaddr objects were being passed
to the json serializer.

For the MACAdddress object, this resulted in an traceback
because EUI types are not json encodable. For the IPNetwork,
this resulted in a list of every IP address in the network.

This fixes both by adding a 'to_primitive' method that calls
str on the netaddr objects, which results in sane representations
(string mac address and string CIDR).

This adds a base test the common types test case to ensure
all primitive representations are json serializable.

Closes-Bug: #1638664
Change-Id: Ic0032e3fc12de643e6900702249e69d3946faa19
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'to_primitive' for MACAddress and IPNetwork

Both of these OVO common types did not have a to_primitive
method, so their native netaddr objects were being passed
to the json serializer.

For the MACAdddress object, this resulted in an traceback
because EUI types are not json encodable. For the IPNetwork,
this resulted in a list of every IP address in the network.

This fixes both by adding a 'to_primitive' method that calls
str on the netaddr objects, which results in sane representations
(string mac address and string CIDR).

This adds a base test the common types test case to ensure
all primitive representations are json serializable.

Closes-Bug: #1638664
Change-Id: Ic0032e3fc12de643e6900702249e69d3946faa19

commit_message:
Add PortGroups API

This patch adds the portgroups API object and REST controller
to Ironic. Additionally this patch provides a PortgroupsCollection
class and PortgroupsPatch class. API version has been bumped to 1.23.

This commit includes changes to:
- the API (addition of portgroup API)
- the API tests

Partial-bug: #1618754

Change-Id: Ie37ab6be65cfb9f368cec7da6b9de78ca5385075

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ie37ab6be65cfb9f368cec7da6b9de78ca5385075

commit_message:
Add reseller_admin_role config to proxy::keystone

The reseller admin role has the ability to create and delete accounts.
Set the default as undef, so that new config is not added until
a user wants to add it.

Also clean up leftover concat items from proxy spec tests.

Change-Id: I5936fe30b1cb7197bf37748f204a054b1e49e430

commit_message:
Allow running expand & migrate at the same time

This will make automation with tools such as puppet easier. Since
keystone-manage will enforce the ordering of expand and migrate.

Change-Id: Ic69b642cfd7b04ca012f1c91781c7f6335d0b747

commit_message:
Do not hide unexpected exceptions in inspection code

We have to at least provide a traceback for Python stdlib exceptions.
Also provide a more meaningful error message to a user in last_error.

Related-Bug: #1550328
Change-Id: I7cbb4bc36b5524c902b587f68212439e8f2d45df

commit_message:
Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network
and a subnet, none 169.254.169.254/24 ip info set in related
namespace(qdhcp-XXX) with `ip a` command. In this case, vms could
not get metadata any more.

Change-Id: Ibd73824658c9759d32fa53ffcf41f2b719c1028b
Closes-Bug: #1549793
(cherry picked from commit dfacba0f2d7586df51962c2b927e5272358ea3c1)

commit_message:
Move class properties to instances for dhcp tests

Using class properties for tests always carries the risk of
conflicting use between test cases when tests are run in parallel.

Related-Bug: #1569507

Change-Id: I5868dd8e3c2293be26fd7c99338f7c979f727533
(cherry picked from commit 7e79137acc060db00c50fb8f0190768df0eb1296)

commit_message:
fix testcase test_check_can_live_migrate_dest_fills_listen_addrs

We should set return_value=1 for compareCPU hook.
Otherwise we'll get an exception InvalidCPUInfo:
CPU doesn't have compatibility

Change-Id: Id9313eb46084e60cf0c7f5a77fe9a8a7dc86b8fb
Closes-Bug: #1634962

commit_message:
Use random name in network common function

Change-ID Ieb211ce48d2368b1f41109c7fd76e818ee69cfe4 seemed like
missing one position, this patch is to append that.

Use random name in basenetworktest function to remove flushing
random name definitions in networkstest.

commit_message:
libvirt: add supported vif types for virtuozzo virt_type

Enable vif driver configuring for virtuozzo and make configuration
parameter use_virtio_for_bridges be usable for virtuozzo hypervisor.

Change-Id: Ied17a5406d5625f1e9f704e5b9b46d300f2870c2
Closes-Bug: #1635230

subject: Added interface parameter for auth
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 12:51:12.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/openstack/credentials.rb'], 'message': 'Added interface parameter for auth

I want to be able to use the internal API endpoints from Puppet.  This is done
by setting $OS_INTERFACE to internal for use with the openstack CLI. This
change will do this by also reading OS_INTERFACE from the environment or
/root/openrc.

Change-Id: Id826836ccfe8f61780a6201ef2851068d75391ab
'}]
commit_message:
Added interface parameter for auth

I want to be able to use the internal API endpoints from Puppet.  This is done
by setting $OS_INTERFACE to internal for use with the openstack CLI. This
change will do this by also reading OS_INTERFACE from the environment or
/root/openrc.

Change-Id: Id826836ccfe8f61780a6201ef2851068d75391ab

commit_message:
Use VolumeDriverException for driver exceptions

These exceptions are volume-driver specific and should
be inherited from VolumeDriverException rather than
CinderException.

Change-Id: I1ceeb15144f06340734084b544b903b6b93e8b07

subject: Remove blacklist test volume
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-10-26 05:27:09.000000000', 'files': ['blacklist-py3.txt', 'trove/guestagent/volume.py'], 'message': "Remove blacklist test volume

Now,We have error in test volume in py3,I have modified the error.
replace NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False) -> NamedTemporaryFile
(mode='w', delete=False).That will open the temporary file in
the text mode.

Closes-Bug #1633789
Change-Id: I24f2fbd13eaacaa0efe5601490cdc08edcd4b1d2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove blacklist test volume

Now,We have error in test volume in py3,I have modified the error.
replace NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False) -> NamedTemporaryFile
(mode='w', delete=False).That will open the temporary file in
the text mode.

Ensure specified OVS bridge is created when plugging

This is based upon the os-vif equivalent patch found at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330818 (os-vif is currently being
integrated into Nova during the Newton cycle). This patch is only for
testing this vif-plugging mechanism until os-vif has been integrated
into Nova.

When a vif will be plugged into an OVS bridge, ensure that the bridge
exists during the plugging operation. In most cases, the OVS bridge will
already exist at the time of port creation, so this will be a no-op.
However, the Neutron OVS agent implementation for vlan-aware VMs will
require Nova to create the OVS bridge if it doesn't already
exist, because vifs that correspond to trunk ports won't be directly
plugged into br-int (they're plugged into their own bridge).

Change-Id: I8d8e2e7b7d17593016ab39f86f3bb50ce0e43927

commit_message:
[DO NOT REVIEW - FOR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY]

Ensure specified OVS bridge is created when plugging

This is based upon the os-vif equivalent patch found at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330818 (os-vif is currently being
integrated into Nova during the Newton cycle). This patch is only for
testing this vif-plugging mechanism until os-vif has been integrated
into Nova.

When a vif will be plugged into an OVS bridge, ensure that the bridge
exists during the plugging operation. In most cases, the OVS bridge will
already exist at the time of port creation, so this will be a no-op.
However, the Neutron OVS agent implementation for vlan-aware VMs will
require Nova to create the OVS bridge if it doesn't already
exist, because vifs that correspond to trunk ports won't be directly
plugged into br-int (they're plugged into their own bridge).

Change-Id: I8d8e2e7b7d17593016ab39f86f3bb50ce0e43927

subject: Validate the API for new potential oslo_db test fixtures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16907, 'name': 'Diana Clarke', 'email': 'diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com', 'username': 'diana-clarke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-01 16:27:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_connection_switch.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py', 'tools/install_gerrit.sh', 'tox.ini', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Validate the API for new potential oslo_db test fixtures

Alters fixtures.Database to work from an in-progress
refactor of oslo_db's test_base module.  Some version
of this change would only be proposed well after oslo.db's
feature is completed and released, and not any sooner
than O.  The API is being live-validated against multiple
consuming openstack projects simultaneously in order to
produce a flexible and future-proof system.

Benefits of the new fixture include:

* full integration with enginefacade

* a slightly more performant sqlite setup/teardown, keeping
  a single memory database with a fully built schema per
  database (e.g. main + api) for the lifespan of a test
  process and deleting from tables during teardown

* full compatibility with opportunistic database testing;
  any test suite can be pulled in to test against MySQL or Postgresql
  by adding a stub class for it.  Schema builds may be reused
  across any number of tests using additional oslo.db
  directives at the module / package level.

As we are testing against a non-merged oslo.db patch, a special
script is included to pull the review from gerrit, as
pip is not currently capable of installing from an in-progress
gerrit review.

Change-Id: I50a0967a01c3e473388057320dc575e78fd9397f
"}]
commit_message:
Validate the API for new potential oslo_db test fixtures

Alters fixtures.Database to work from an in-progress
refactor of oslo_db's test_base module.  Some version
of this change would only be proposed well after oslo.db's
feature is completed and released, and not any sooner
than O.  The API is being live-validated against multiple
consuming openstack projects simultaneously in order to
produce a flexible and future-proof system.

Benefits of the new fixture include:

* full integration with enginefacade

* a slightly more performant sqlite setup/teardown, keeping
  a single memory database with a fully built schema per
  database (e.g. main + api) for the lifespan of a test
  process and deleting from tables during teardown

* full compatibility with opportunistic database testing;
  any test suite can be pulled in to test against MySQL or Postgresql
  by adding a stub class for it.  Schema builds may be reused
  across any number of tests using additional oslo.db
  directives at the module / package level.

As we are testing against a non-merged oslo.db patch, a special
script is included to pull the review from gerrit, as
pip is not currently capable of installing from an in-progress
gerrit review.

Change-Id: I50a0967a01c3e473388057320dc575e78fd9397f

commit_message:
Stop our changes to /etc/sudoers from tripping up apt-get

The Mitaka and Liberty scripts currently fail because preseed's changes
to /etc/sudoers result in a problem (i.e., a prompt) when apt-get tries
to install an update for the sudo package.

This bug has been fixed in Newton but needed backporting to Liberty
and Mitaka.

Change-Id: I6ca06d1845412cc2eb451b67d9c74f4772950a7f

subject: Clear the old environment in rc file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 20:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Clear the old environment in rc file

When sourcing the Keystone RC file, some of the variable options are
conflicting, and may provide the wrong information to a token request.
For example, If both OS_USERNAME and OS_USER_ID are passed, the
Keystone Client has to chose which one to add to the token request,
and it might not be the one the user expects.  The same is true for
any value that can be passed both by name and ID. In addition, some
of the combinations lead to cryptic error messages.

To clearly identify the users intention, the old environment is
cleared of all variables that start with the `OS_` prefix
before setting any new variables.

Change-Id: I6badc5864426a371323a59100155e1c284af84b8
(cherry picked from commit 04f9600c69b95a6e56fa3591515a8f62b9a35223)
'}]
commit_message:
Clear the old environment in rc file

When sourcing the Keystone RC file, some of the variable options are
conflicting, and may provide the wrong information to a token request.
For example, If both OS_USERNAME and OS_USER_ID are passed, the
Keystone Client has to chose which one to add to the token request,
and it might not be the one the user expects.  The same is true for
any value that can be passed both by name and ID. In addition, some
of the combinations lead to cryptic error messages.

To clearly identify the users intention, the old environment is
cleared of all variables that start with the `OS_` prefix
before setting any new variables.

Change-Id: I6badc5864426a371323a59100155e1c284af84b8
(cherry picked from commit 04f9600c69b95a6e56fa3591515a8f62b9a35223)

subject: RabbitMQ Upgrade Testing
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-02 15:13:19.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': "RabbitMQ Upgrade Testing

This commit does the following three things:

1. Updates test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml to use the correct
   rabbitmq host group
2. Copies test-upgrade.yml to test.yml, which should test both
   installation and upgrade of RabbitMQ
3. Updates test.yml to only perform upgrade testing when the package
   manager is != 'yum', this is due to [1]
4. Deletes test-upgrade.yml

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/4547

Change-Id: I8f6c1b8d0de4666ab5f892162caa66f5c5c966d9
"}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ Upgrade Testing

This commit does the following three things:

1. Updates test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml to use the correct
   rabbitmq host group
2. Copies test-upgrade.yml to test.yml, which should test both
   installation and upgrade of RabbitMQ
3. Updates test.yml to only perform upgrade testing when the package
   manager is != 'yum', this is due to [1]
4. Deletes test-upgrade.yml

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/4547

Change-Id: I8f6c1b8d0de4666ab5f892162caa66f5c5c966d9
